blocks.name: latdisd
blocks.content: In a lattice, joins distribute over meets if and only if meets distribute over joins; the distributive property is self-dual. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 29-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: df-dlat
blocks.content: A _distributive lattice_ is a lattice in which meets distribute over joins, or equivalently ( ~ latdisd ) joins distribute over meets. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 30-Jan-2015.)

thm dlatjmdi(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cdlat), w3a(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c4, c2))), wceq(co(c1, c5, co(c3, c6, c4)), co(co(c1, c5, c3), c6, co(c1, c5, c4))))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cjn, c0))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cmee, c0))
} = {
  sylan(wcel(c0, cdlat), w3a(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c4, c2)), wceq(co(c1, c5, co(c3, c6, c4)), co(co(c1, c5, c3), c6, co(c1, c5, c4))), wcel(cfv(codu, c0), cdlat))
  ibi(wcel(c0, cdlat), wcel(cfv(codu, c0), cdlat))

  sylan(c0 ∈ DLat, (c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2 ∧ c4 ∈ c2), (c1[c5](c3[c6]c4))=((c1[c5]c3)[c6](c1[c5]c4)), (ODual ` c0)∈ DLat)
